title: Dragon (UnNetHack)
data:
In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") and [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack"), the **[dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")** [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") is significantly changed from *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 List of dragons](#List_of_dragons)
- [2 Randomized traits](#Randomized_traits)
- [3 Generation](#Generation)
- [4 Chromatic dragons](#Chromatic_dragons)
- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)

## List of dragons

The following dragons are present in UnNetHack and DynaHack:

- Adult dragons:

  - D tatzelworm, or [magic dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon")
  - D amphitere, or [reflecting dragon](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon")
  - D draken, or [fire dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon")
  - D lindworm, or [ice dragon](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon")
  - D sarkany, or [sleep dragon](/wiki/Orange_dragon "Orange dragon")
  - D sirrush, or [disintegration dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")
  - D leviathan, or [electric dragon](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon")
  - D wyvern, or [poison dragon](/wiki/Green_dragon "Green dragon")
  - D [glowing dragon](/wiki/Glowing_dragon "Glowing dragon") (gold dragon in DynaHack), or stone dragon
  - D guivre, or [acid dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon")

- D [chromatic dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)")

- Baby dragons:

  - D tatzelworm, or [baby magic dragon](/wiki/Baby_gray_dragon "Baby gray dragon")
  - D amphitere, or [baby reflecting dragon](/wiki/Baby_silver_dragon "Baby silver dragon")
  - D draken, or [baby fire dragon](/wiki/Baby_red_dragon "Baby red dragon")
  - D lindworm, or [baby ice dragon](/wiki/Baby_white_dragon "Baby white dragon")
  - D sarkany, or [baby sleep dragon](/wiki/Baby_orange_dragon "Baby orange dragon")
  - D sirrush, or [baby disintegration dragon](/wiki/Baby_black_dragon "Baby black dragon")
  - D leviathan, or [baby electric dragon](/wiki/Baby_blue_dragon "Baby blue dragon")
  - D wyvern, or [baby poison dragon](/wiki/Baby_green_dragon "Baby green dragon")
  - D [baby glowing dragon](/wiki/Baby_glowing_dragon "Baby glowing dragon") (gold dragon in DynaHack), or stone dragon
  - D guivre, or [baby acid dragon](/wiki/Baby_yellow_dragon "Baby yellow dragon")

## Randomized traits

With the exception of the chromatic dragon, each dragon in UnNetHack and DynaHack has a breath weapon, elemental resistance(s) and color randomly assigned to each of them at the start of a game, making it impossible to predict breath type based on name or color. The list above gives the default appearances and types of each dragon - all dragons use the D and are given a different-colored glyph once identified, and dragons of the same name or color within a game are always of the same type. Dragons are auto-identified upon witnessing their breath attack, and identifying one dragon also identifies all dragons of that type (including babies), as well as their [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales") and the [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") that can be made from it; the reverse also applies for identifying a set of dragon scales or scale mail. The stats of the dragons themselves are identical to the dragons of *NetHack*.

The glowing dragon is a form of dragon that [emits light](/wiki/Light_source "Light source"), and their scales and scale mail also act as light sources in addition to the random property they are assigned. Both variants also add [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") breath as a possible breath weapon for dragons: lava breath deals heavy fire damage, melts through [walls](/wiki/Wall "Wall") instead of rebounding like other breath weapons, and creates a square of lava where the breath ray terminates.

Below is a table that lists the names given to dragons and their scale types, alongside the default set of properties, breath weapon and color associated with each one:

| Dragon                          | Breath         | Intrinsics                          | Scale properties          | Corpse properties (adults only) |
| ------------------------------- | -------------- | ----------------------------------- | ------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| tatzelworm (magic dragon)       | magic missile  | magic resistance                    | magic resistance          | none                            |
| amphitere (reflecting dragon)   | cold           | cold resistance                     | reflection                | none                            |
| draken (fire dragon)            | fire           | fire resistance                     | fire resistance           | fire resistance                 |
| lindworm (ice dragon)           | cold           | cold resistance                     | cold resistance           | cold resistance                 |
| sarkany (sleep dragon)          | sleep          | sleep resistance                    | sleep resistance          | sleep resistance                |
| sirrush (disintegration dragon) | disintegration | disintegration resistance           | disintegration resistance | disintegration resistance       |
| leviathan (electric dragon)     | lightning      | shock resistance                    | shock resistance          | shock resistance                |
| wyvern (poison dragon)          | poison         | poison resistance                   | poison resistance         | poison resistance               |
| glowing dragon (stone dragon)   | lava           | stoning resistance, fire resistance | stoning resistance        | fire resistance                 |
| guivre (acid dragon)            | acid           | acid resistance, stoning resistance | acid resistance           | cures stoning                   |

## Generation

In addition to generation rules from *NetHack*, several dragons are generated on each level of [The Dragon Caves](/wiki/The_Dragon_Caves "The Dragon Caves") at level creation.

## Chromatic dragons

- *Main article: [Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)")*

The chromatic dragon is a rare and non-[unique](/wiki/Unique "Unique") form of dragon that has the resistances and breath weapons of all dragons, similar to the Chromatic Dragon of *NetHack* (who is known as Tiamat in these variants); their [scales](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_scales_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon scales (UnNetHack)") and [scale mail](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_scale_mail_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon scale mail (UnNetHack)") grant the same properties. Chromatic dragons are similar to other adult dragons in stature and attributes, but do not have a baby form.

## Strategy

The randomization of dragon breath types makes it more difficult for a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") to handle dragons and try to obtain their scales without preparation, and in some cases it can be immediately lethal if a disintegration dragon is one of the first that they encounter. In addition, [wishes](/wiki/Wish "Wish") that are not from a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") cannot be used to obtain [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item"): this means that heroes seeking [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") to deal with dragonbreath are more reliant on specific sources, such as the prize selection from [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") (which differs between [UnNetHack](/wiki/Sokoban_\(UnNetHack\) "Sokoban (UnNetHack)") and [DynaHack](/index.php?title=Sokoban_\(DynaHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sokoban (DynaHack) (page does not exist)")).

Fortunately, the [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") is non-magical in UnNetHack and DynaHack, making it a more ideal early wish; dragon scales are non-magical as in *NetHack*, and glowing dragon scales may be worth a wish for a light source and a chance at possible [magic dragon scales](/wiki/Magic_dragon_scales "Magic dragon scales") or [reflecting dragon scales](/wiki/Reflecting_dragon_scales "Reflecting dragon scales").

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Dragon (UnNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In UnNetHack and DynaHack, the dragon monster class is significantly changed from NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 List of dragons
  • 2 Randomized traits
  • 3 Generation
  • 4 Chromatic dragons
  • 5 Strategy

List of dragons

The following dragons are present in UnNetHack and DynaHack:

  • Adult dragons:
    • D tatzelworm, or magic dragon
    • D amphitere, or reflecting dragon
    • D draken, or fire dragon
    • D lindworm, or ice dragon
    • D sarkany, or sleep dragon
    • D sirrush, or disintegration dragon
    • D leviathan, or electric dragon
    • D wyvern, or poison dragon
    • D glowing dragon (gold dragon in DynaHack), or stone dragon
    • D guivre, or acid dragon
  • D chromatic dragon
  • Baby dragons:
    • D tatzelworm, or baby magic dragon
    • D amphitere, or baby reflecting dragon
    • D draken, or baby fire dragon
    • D lindworm, or baby ice dragon
    • D sarkany, or baby sleep dragon
    • D sirrush, or baby disintegration dragon
    • D leviathan, or baby electric dragon
    • D wyvern, or baby poison dragon
    • D baby glowing dragon (gold dragon in DynaHack), or stone dragon
    • D guivre, or baby acid dragon

Randomized traits

With the exception of the chromatic dragon, each dragon in UnNetHack and DynaHack has a breath weapon, elemental resistance(s) and color randomly assigned to each of them at the start of a game, making it impossible to predict breath type based on name or color. The list above gives the default appearances and types of each dragon - all dragons use the D and are given a different-colored glyph once identified, and dragons of the same name or color within a game are always of the same type. Dragons are auto-identified upon witnessing their breath attack, and identifying one dragon also identifies all dragons of that type (including babies), as well as their dragon scales and the dragon scale mail that can be made from it; the reverse also applies for identifying a set of dragon scales or scale mail. The stats of the dragons themselves are identical to the dragons of NetHack.

The glowing dragon is a form of dragon that emits light, and their scales and scale mail also act as light sources in addition to the random property they are assigned. Both variants also add lava breath as a possible breath weapon for dragons: lava breath deals heavy fire damage, melts through walls instead of rebounding like other breath weapons, and creates a square of lava where the breath ray terminates.

Below is a table that lists the names given to dragons and their scale types, alongside the default set of properties, breath weapon and color associated with each one:

Dragon Breath Intrinsics Scale properties Corpse properties (adults only)
tatzelworm (magic dragon) magic missile magic resistance magic resistance none
amphitere (reflecting dragon) cold cold resistance reflection none
draken (fire dragon) fire fire resistance fire resistance fire resistance
lindworm (ice dragon) cold cold resistance cold resistance cold resistance
sarkany (sleep dragon) sleep sleep resistance sleep resistance sleep resistance
sirrush (disintegration dragon) disintegration disintegration resistance disintegration resistance disintegration resistance
leviathan (electric dragon) lightning shock resistance shock resistance shock resistance
wyvern (poison dragon) poison poison resistance poison resistance poison resistance
glowing dragon (stone dragon) lava stoning resistance, fire resistance stoning resistance fire resistance
guivre (acid dragon) acid acid resistance, stoning resistance acid resistance cures stoning

Generation

In addition to generation rules from NetHack, several dragons are generated on each level of The Dragon Caves at level creation.

Chromatic dragons

Main article: Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)

The chromatic dragon is a rare and non-unique form of dragon that has the resistances and breath weapons of all dragons, similar to the Chromatic Dragon of NetHack (who is known as Tiamat in these variants); their scales and scale mail grant the same properties. Chromatic dragons are similar to other adult dragons in stature and attributes, but do not have a baby form.

Strategy

The randomization of dragon breath types makes it more difficult for a hero to handle dragons and try to obtain their scales without preparation, and in some cases it can be immediately lethal if a disintegration dragon is one of the first that they encounter. In addition, wishes that are not from a wand of wishing cannot be used to obtain magical items: this means that heroes seeking reflection to deal with dragonbreath are more reliant on specific sources, such as the prize selection from Sokoban (which differs between UnNetHack and DynaHack).

Fortunately, the shield of reflection is non-magical in UnNetHack and DynaHack, making it a more ideal early wish; dragon scales are non-magical as in NetHack, and glowing dragon scales may be worth a wish for a light source and a chance at possible magic dragon scales or reflecting dragon scales.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Dragon_(UnNetHack)&oldid=176958"

In [[UnNetHack]] and [[DynaHack]], the '''[[dragon]]''' [[monster class]] is significantly changed from ''[[NetHack]]''.

==List of dragons==
The following dragons are present in UnNetHack and DynaHack:

* Adult dragons:
** {{brown|D}} tatzelworm, or [[Gray dragon|magic dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} amphitere, or [[Silver dragon|reflecting dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} draken, or [[Red dragon|fire dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} lindworm, or [[White dragon|ice dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} sarkany, or [[Orange dragon|sleep dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} sirrush, or [[Black dragon|disintegration dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} leviathan, or [[Blue dragon|electric dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} wyvern, or [[Green dragon|poison dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} [[glowing dragon]] (gold dragon in DynaHack), or stone dragon
** {{brown|D}} guivre, or [[Yellow dragon|acid dragon]]
* {{magenta|D}} [[Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)|chromatic dragon]]
* Baby dragons:
** {{brown|D}} tatzelworm, or [[Baby gray dragon|baby magic dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} amphitere, or [[Baby silver dragon|baby reflecting dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} draken, or [[Baby red dragon|baby fire dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} lindworm, or [[Baby white dragon|baby ice dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} sarkany, or [[Baby orange dragon|baby sleep dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} sirrush, or [[Baby black dragon|baby disintegration dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} leviathan, or [[Baby blue dragon|baby electric dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} wyvern, or [[Baby green dragon|baby poison dragon]]
** {{brown|D}} [[baby glowing dragon]] (gold dragon in DynaHack), or stone dragon
** {{brown|D}} guivre, or [[Baby yellow dragon|baby acid dragon]]

==Randomized traits==
With the exception of the chromatic dragon, each dragon in UnNetHack and DynaHack has a breath weapon, elemental resistance(s) and color randomly assigned to each of them at the start of a game, making it impossible to predict breath type based on name or color. The list above gives the default appearances and types of each dragon - all dragons use the {{brown|D}} and are given a different-colored glyph once identified, and dragons of the same name or color within a game are always of the same type. Dragons are auto-identified upon witnessing their breath attack, and identifying one dragon also identifies all dragons of that type (including babies), as well as their [[dragon scales]] and the [[dragon scale mail]] that can be made from it; the reverse also applies for identifying a set of dragon scales or scale mail. The stats of the dragons themselves are identical to the dragons of ''NetHack''.

The glowing dragon is a form of dragon that [[Light source|emits light]], and their scales and scale mail also act as light sources in addition to the random property they are assigned. Both variants also add [[lava]] breath as a possible breath weapon for dragons: lava breath deals heavy fire damage, melts through [[wall]]s instead of rebounding like other breath weapons, and creates a square of lava where the breath ray terminates.

Below is a table that lists the names given to dragons and their scale types, alongside the default set of properties, breath weapon and color associated with each one:

==Generation==
In addition to generation rules from ''NetHack'', several dragons are generated on each level of [[The Dragon Caves]] at level creation.

==Chromatic dragons==
{{main|Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)}}
The chromatic dragon is a rare and non-[[unique]] form of dragon that has the resistances and breath weapons of all dragons, similar to the Chromatic Dragon of ''NetHack'' (who is known as Tiamat in these variants); their [[Chromatic dragon scales (UnNetHack)|scales]] and [[Chromatic dragon scale mail (UnNetHack)|scale mail]] grant the same properties. Chromatic dragons are similar to other adult dragons in stature and attributes, but do not have a baby form.

==Strategy==
The randomization of dragon breath types makes it more difficult for a [[hero]] to handle dragons and try to obtain their scales without preparation, and in some cases it can be immediately lethal if a disintegration dragon is one of the first that they encounter. In addition, [[wish]]es that are not from a [[wand of wishing]] cannot be used to obtain [[magical item]]s: this means that heroes seeking [[reflection]] to deal with dragonbreath are more reliant on specific sources, such as the prize selection from [[Sokoban]] (which differs between [[Sokoban (UnNetHack)|UnNetHack]] and [[Sokoban (DynaHack)|DynaHack]]).

Fortunately, the [[shield of reflection]] is non-magical in UnNetHack and DynaHack, making it a more ideal early wish; dragon scales are non-magical as in ''NetHack'', and glowing dragon scales may be worth a wish for a light source and a chance at possible [[magic dragon scales]] or [[reflecting dragon scales]].
